position.marginalia_text: Arguta altercatio: quales multa[e] in Seneca[e] Tragoedijs.

marginalia.translation: A clever argument, such as those many ones found in Seneca's Tragedies.
If the writing is much, the effect is nothing.

position.marginalia_text: { Lege ista sa[e]pè, sa[e]piùs: nec opus est plura scripturire, sed plus efficere.

marginalia.translation: Read these things more and more; and it is not necessary to desire to write much, but rather to do more.
Clerke: someone who neverless wrote little and excelled much.

position.marginalia_text: Leaue scribbling: quoth Rochester: & now in deed to the purpose.
Aut me decepisti: aut tarditatem compensabis grauitate. Prudens aliquando Serò sapit: nunq[uam] nimis serò.

marginalia.translation: Either you have deceived me, or you will compensate this tardiness with gravity. The prudent man sometimes learns late, but he never learns too late.

position.marginalia_text: Sed is erat animus viri ad maiores functiones aspirantis. Quoduis { scriptum, nimis; nullum actum Satis videbatur.

marginalia.translation: However this is the mind of a man aspiring to greater accomplishments. Whatever is written is too much; no act was ever seen enough.

position.marginalia_text: Ezechiel, Esdras, prophetarum filij in campis ieiuni. Cum libris, et instrumentis.

marginalia.translation: Ezekiel, Ezra, the children of prophets, fasting in the desert with books and instruments.

position.marginalia_text: So that sharp Bishop to miself, & sum other: whome he thowght as sufficiently qualified, as Dr Lewen, Dr Clark, or other fine pragmaticians in [the] Sun.
Viuitur eloquio: vincitur ingenio. Eutrapelus. Rhetorica[e], et Logica[e] vsus in mundo maximus. Viuitur obsequio: vincitur imperio. Cosmopolita.

marginalia.translation: One lives by eloquence; one conquers by genius. Eutrapelus. The greatest use in the world of rhetoric and logic. One lives by obedience; one conquers by command. Cosmopolitan.

position.marginalia_text: Magneticum artis, virtutisq[ue] Speculum vel ordinaria via trahit Singula: vel extraordinaria vi rapit omnia.

marginalia.translation: The magnetic mirror of art and virtue can either draw ordinary matters down a singular path; or seize all things with an extraordinary force.
